articles.author: Hyunjoo Jin, Dan Levine
articles.description: A Florida judge found "reasonable evidence" that Tesla Chief Executive Elon Musk and other managers knew the automaker's vehicles had a defective Autopilot system but still allowed the cars to be driven unsafely, according to a ruling.
articles.title: Judge finds evidence that Tesla, Musk knew about Autopilot defect

articles.author: Tom Westbrook
articles.description: Asian stocks backed away from 2-1/2-month high on Wednesday and the dollar found support as investors' tempered some of their earlier enthusiasm about the prospect of an end to U.S. rate hikes.
articles.title: Asia stocks slip as dovish Fed cheer fades

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two luxury homes in Hong Kong owned by the chairman of embattled property developer China Evergrande Group (3333.HK), Hui Ka Yan, have been seized by a creditor, local media outlet HK01 reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: Evergrande chairman's two luxury mansions seized by creditor - local media

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: Federal Reserve officials agreed at their last policy meeting they could take a cautious approach to raising U.S. interest rates moving forward, and would only need to move them higher "if" incoming information showed insufficient progress in lowering inflation.
articles.title: Fed minutes anchor cautious policy approach as risks become more two-sided

articles.author: Chavi Mehta, Max Cherney, Stephen Nellis
articles.description: Chip designer Nvidia (NVDA.O) said on Tuesday it expects a steep drop in fourth-quarter sales in China - a key revenue generator - in the wake of new U.S. rules, but forecast overall revenue above Wall Street targets as supply-chain issues ease.
articles.title: Nvidia outlook beats expectations but China worries linger

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Billionaire investor Warren Buffett said Berkshire Hathaway (BRKa.N) has the "right CEO" to succeed him and the "right board of directors", the company disclosed in a letter from him on Tuesday which disclosed he donated about $866 million of Berkshire stock to four family charities.
articles.title: Buffett donates stock, says Berkshire has the 'right CEO' to succeed him

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sony (6758.T) must face a mass lawsuit worth up to 6.3 billion pounds ($7.9 billion) over claims the PlayStation maker abused its dominant position leading to unfair prices for customers, a London tribunal ruled on Tuesday.
articles.title: Sony facing $7.9 bln mass lawsuit over PlayStation Store prices

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israel's government met into the early hours of Wednesday to consider a deal for Palestinian Hamas militants to free some hostages in Gaza in exchange for a multi-day truce and the release of a greater number of Palestinian prisoners in Israel.
articles.title: Israeli government debates deal for release of Gaza hostages, truce

articles.author: Chris Prentice, David Lawder, Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Binance chief Changpeng Zhao will step down and plead guilty to breaking criminal U.S. anti-money laundering laws as part of a $4 billion settlement resolving a years-long probe into the world's largest crypto exchange, prosecutors said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Binance's Zhao to plead guilty, step down to settle US illicit finance probe

articles.author: Steve Gorman
articles.description: At least one person has been killed and multiple others were believed to be missing in a major landslide along the principal roadway serving an island community in Southeast Alaska, state officials said on Tuesday.
articles.title: One dead, multiple others believed missing in Alaska landslide
